text.0: this holy hymn sublime and sevenheaded sprung from eternal law our sire discovered.
text.1: ayasya friend of all men hath engendered the fourth hymn as he sang his laud to indra.
text.2: thinking aright praising eternal order the sons of dyaus the asura those heroes.
text.3: aṅgirases holding the rank of sages first honoured sacrifices holy statute.
text.4: girt by his friends who cried with swanlike voices bursting the stony barriers of the prison.
text.5: bṛhaspati spake in thunder to the cattle and uttered praise and song when he had found them.
text.6: apart from one away from two above him he drave the kine that stood in bonds of falsehood.
text.7: bṛhaspati seeking light amid the darkness drave forth the bright cows three he made apparent.
text.8: when he had cleft the lairs and western castle he cut off three from him who held the waters.
text.9: bṛhaspati discovered while he thundered like dyaus the dawn the sun the cow the lightning.
text.10: as with a hand so with his roaring indra cleft vala through the guardian of the cattle.
text.11: seeking the milkdraught with sweatshining comrades he stole the paṇis kine and left him weeping.
text.12: he with bright faithful friends winners of booty hath rent the milker of the cows asunder.
text.13: bṛhaspati with wild boars strong and mighty sweating with heat hath gained a rich possession.
text.14: they longing for the kine with faithful spirit incited with their hymns the lord of cattle.
text.15: bṛhaspati freed the radiant cows with comrades selfyoked averting shame from one another.
text.16: in our assembly with auspicious praises exalting him who roareth like a lion.
text.17: maywe in every fight where heroes conquer rejoice in strong bṛhaspati the victor.
text.18: when he had won him every sort of booty and gone to heaven and its most lofty mansions.
text.19: men praised bṛhaspati the mighty bringing the light within their mouths from sundry places.
text.20: fulfil the prayer that begs for vital vigour aid in your wonted manner even the humble.
text.21: let all our foes be turned and driven backward hear this o heaven and earth ye allproducers.
text.22: indra with mighty strength cleft asunder the head of arbuda the watery monster.
text.23: slain ahi and set free the seven rivers o heaven and earth with all the gods protect us.
